Poster Submissions

Showcase Your Research at the Winter School: Next-Generation AI and Economic Applications!

The Winter School: Next-Generation AI and Economic Applications invites participants to submit posters.

Posters should highlight innovative research, real-world applications, or groundbreaking methodologies in AI, particularly in economic and societal contexts.

// Topics icon

Topics of Interest

We encourage submissions that explore:

  • AI and Machine Learning
  • Data Science and Big Data
  • Industrial Applications of AI
  • Economic and Societal Impact of AI
// Calendar icon

Submission Deadline

All submissions must be received by January 31, 2025.

// Award icon

Selection Process

A prestigious jury of experts will evaluate all posters based on **innovation**, **scientific rigor**, and **relevance to AI and its applications**. 15 posters will be selected for the event.

// Gift icon

Waived Registration Fees

Selected posters will benefit from waived Winter School registration fees, providing you complimentary access to the event and its exclusive sessions.

// Presentation icon

Poster Session

Selected posters will be printed at no cost and displayed during the poster session, providing opportunities for in-depth discussions and networking with distinguished attendees, including AI pioneers like Yann LeCun and Michael Jordan.

// Download icon

Download the Template

Use our template to ensure consistent formatting and build a visually engaging design summarizing your work.

// Submission icon

How to Submit

Submissions are accepted via the Google Form. Ensure all required fields are completed before submitting.

// Requirements icon

Submission Requirements

Your poster must:

  • Include authors' names and affiliations.
  • Clearly present objectives, methods, and results.
  • Highlight key bibliography/references.

Ready to Submit?

Don’t miss this opportunity to Showcase your poster at a cutting-edge AI event, gain valuable feedback from AI thought leaders and expand your professional network in Ben Guerir, Morocco.
